task.summary: add: initial implementation of JRA Calendar API with AWS Lambda integration
add: implement JRA Calendar API with AWS Lambda, including response handling and calendar configuration

Add requirements files for production and development
Created `requirements.txt` for production dependencies and `requirements-dev.txt` for development dependencies. This includes libraries for Google APIs, AWS SDK (boto3), and key development tools like pytest. Ensures clear segregation of runtime and development dependencies.

Add example environment variables file for Lambda setup
This commit introduces an `env.example` file to document required environment variables for the Lambda configuration. It includes settings for Google Cloud, calendar configurations, and AWS. This serves as a reference for setting up the deployment environment.

Add package.json and package-lock.json for Lambda setup
Added `package.json` and `package-lock.json` to initialize the project dependencies and configuration for the JRA Calendar API Lambda function. This includes scripts for deployment, logs, local invocation, and testing, as well as required packages for serverless deployment.

Add calendar service and Lambda handler for JRA events API
Implemented a calendar service to interface with Google Calendar, added utilities for response handling, and created a Lambda handler to fetch and sort JRA calendar events by date. Configurations and API credentials are managed via environment variables.

Add calendar service and Lambda handler for JRA events API
Implemented a calendar service to interface with Google Calendar, added utilities for response handling, and created a Lambda handler to fetch and sort JRA calendar events by date. Configurations and API credentials are managed via environment variables.

Update IDE configuration with test cases and task history
Added new test configurations for `TestLambdaHandler` and modified default test selections. Updated task history and IDE settings to reflect recent project changes, including environment setup and task tracking.

Add debug print statement in test_main.py
A print statement was introduced to output the `body` variable during the test for additional debugging information. This will help in verifying the data structure during test execution.

Add debug print statement in test_main.py
A print statement was introduced to output the `body` variable during the test for additional debugging information. This will help in verifying the data structure during test execution.
Update IDE configuration and task history
Add serverless configuration and deployment workflow for JRA calendar API
Add deployment workflow for AWS Lambda and create TODO list for project setup

Update README.md to enhance API description and clarify setup instructions

Add requirements files for production and development
Created `requirements.txt` for production dependencies and `requirements-dev.txt` for development dependencies. This includes libraries for Google APIs, AWS SDK (boto3), and key development tools like pytest. Ensures clear segregation of runtime and development dependencies.
add: implement JRA Calendar API with AWS Lambda, including response handling and calendar configuration

Add env.example file for configuration reference
Include Google Cloud, calendar, and AWS-related environment variables in the example file. This provides a template for setting up the required configurations easily.

Add example environment variables file for Lambda setup
This commit introduces an `env.example` file to document required environment variables for the Lambda configuration. It includes settings for Google Cloud, calendar configurations, and AWS. This serves as a reference for setting up the deployment environment.

Add package.json and package-lock.json for Lambda setup
Added `package.json` and `package-lock.json` to initialize the project dependencies and configuration for the JRA Calendar API Lambda function. This includes scripts for deployment, logs, local invocation, and testing, as well as required packages for serverless deployment.

Add calendar service and Lambda handler for JRA events API
Implemented a calendar service to interface with Google Calendar, added utilities for response handling, and created a Lambda handler to fetch and sort JRA calendar events by date. Configurations and API credentials are managed via environment variables.

Update IDE configuration with test cases and task history
Added new test configurations for `TestLambdaHandler` and modified default test selections. Updated task history and IDE settings to reflect recent project changes, including environment setup and task tracking.

Add debug print statement in test_main.py
A print statement was introduced to output the `body` variable during the test for additional debugging information. This will help in verifying the data structure during test execution.
